intro: Brachyscome formosa, commonly known as the "Blue Mistflower," is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming habit with silvery-blue foliage and showy, daisy-like flowers. Brachyscome formosa thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long flowering period, which extends from spring to autumn.
